item.title: Welcome to CORE Environmental Consultants
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Quality, Leadership, Value... Finding Innovative Solutions to Our Client’s Environmental Issues.
At CORE Environmental, Inc. we provide our clients with solutions to their challenging environmental needs. Whether it is a due diligence review, site remediation, abatement monitoring, or lead and asbestos testing, we are ready to take on any project.
As one of our goals, we promote skills and values development among our professional and support staff. We seek opportunities to offer our knowledge, skills and abilities to provide value added services, recognizing the necessity to perform in an increasingly complex regulatory environment.
CORE currently employs nearly 50 environmental professionals in two offices in New York State. CORE Environmental, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

item.title: History
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Our company was founded in 2004 with a commitment to design solutions to our client’s environmental problems. Since that time we have helped numerous individuals, companies and municipalities. CORE is a Certified Woman Owned Business Enterprise and currently employs nearly 50 environmental professionals in two offices in New York State. CORE is well qualified to take on the challenges of any environmental project.
CORE Environmental, Inc. (CORE) is a multi-disciplinary environmental consulting firm specializing in asbestos containing material survey, design, and abatement project monitoring, lead paint abatement oversight, soil and groundwater investigations and remediation. CORE has provided a broad array of environmental services including – but not limited to – Phase I and II site assessments, Petroleum Bulk Storage (PBS) Tank audits, removals and closures, State Environmental Quality Review Act (SEQRA) and City Environmental Quality Review (CEQR) and the Uniform Land Use Review Procedure (ULURP), remedial investigations, remedial studies, construction support, risk assessments, and Resource Conservation Recovery Act (RCRA) audits, discharge permits (NYCDEP/SPDES) and asbestos and lead surveys and project monitoring.
We have provided these services to numerous clients including New York City Transit Authority, New York City Department of Environmental Protection, New York City School Construction Authority, and numerous private organizations as well.
Much of our success is attributable to our ability to work closely with our clients and provide the exact level of support that they need. We always strive to work as an extension of our client's staff. This approach enables us to recognize any potential problems which may arise during the course of a project.

Some of our clients include:

  • Restored Homes Houseing Development Fund Corporation

  • Ryder Trucking

item.title: Certifications
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Environmental services are highly regulated with multiple certifications necessary for our employees continued training status to be current. We encourage all employees to seek out learning opportunities that will assist their performance and enhance revenues of the company. Training and Licensing programs are available to qualified staff with course fees paid for by CORE.

ENVIRONMENTAL CERTIFICATIONS / LICENSES

CORE has the certifications and licenses that allow us to complete business in a highly skilled and regulated work environment. The environmental consulting profession requires obtaining the appropriate licenses and certificates that exhibit our knowledge, training and expertise as a company to perform in the field as well as in the office.
  • The New York State Department of Labor (NYSDOL) has issued CORE an Asbestos Handling Licensed since 2004 to work on asbestos projects in New York State.
  • The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (USEPA) has certified CORE to conduct lead based paint activities throughout the United States and its territories pursuant to 40 CFR Part 745.226.
  • The New York State Department of Health (NYSDOH) has issued us a Radioactive Materials License to use sealed source portable x–ray fluorescence (ZRF) devices to test for lead in New York state since 2006

BUSINESS CERTIFICATES

CORE has the business certificates from numerous agencies that confirm our Woman- Owned Business (WBE), Disadvantaged Business Enterprise (DBE), Small Business Enterprise (SBE) and Locally Based Enterprise (LBE) to perform various testing, inspections and remediation services throughout New York.
  • The New York State Department of Economic Development has certified CORE as a WBE.
  • The New York State Unified Certification Program (NYSUCP), has determined that CORE meets the eligibility criteria established by the U.S. Department of Transportation and has been certified as a Disadvantaged Business Enterprise (DBE).
  • The New York City Department Small Business Services has certified CORE as a WBE and as a Locally Based Enterprise (LBE).
  • The City of Buffalo / County of Erie Joint Certification Committee has certified CORE as a WBE to provide Environmental Consulting and Remediation Services.
  • The Port Authority of New York and New Jersey has certified CORE as a Small Business Enterprise (Commodity Program) and a WBE as established by the Port Authority Policy for Revised Minority, Women and Small Business Enterprise (M/W/SBE) Programs.
  • New York City School Construction Authority has certified CORE as a WBE and LBE.

PERSONNEL CREDENTIALS

Our people at CORE have the knowledge, experience and training to complete the tasks at hand. The specialized training our staff completes includes numerous classes, seminars and continuing education programs.
  • NYSDOL Asbestos Project Monitor training to allow us to perform third party abatement project air monitoring.
  • NYSDOL Asbestos Project Designer training lets us complete asbestos abatement project design and specifications.
  • USEPA Lead Inspector training allows us to complete lead inspections of residential, commercial, and industrial properties as well as in schools.
  • USEPA Lead Risk Assessor training allows us to complete lead inspections as well as clearance testing after abatement of lead in residential, commercial and industrial properties as well as in schools.
  • XRF Unit Manufacturer training is completed to allow our inspectors to be licensed to use the XRF devices to test for lead.
  • Occupational Health and Safety Administration (OSHA) 40 hour hazardous waste site worker training is completed under OSHA’s Hazardous Waste Operations and Emergency Response (HAZWOPER) Regulation [29 CFR 1910.120(e)]. Our team gets the knowledge and skills necessary for personal protection and safety when working with or around hazardous materials and/or waste for extended durations since they are medically monitored and tested.
  • OSHA 24 hour hazardous waste site worker training is completed under OSHA’s Hazardous Waste Operations and Emergency Response (HAZWOPER) Regulation [29 CFR 1910.120(e) (3)(ii)] to allow our workers to perform site work activities for limited periods mostly to perform a specific limited task like sampling and monitoring
  • The OSHA 10 hour Construction Industry Outreach Training Program training provides our employees a general awareness on recognizing and preventing hazards on a construction site.
  • OSHA's Confined Space Training [29 CFR 1910.146] allows us to access Permit-Required Confined Spaces to perform work including inspection, testing and monitoring.
  • Steel Structures Painting Council (SSPC) now known as the Society for Protective Coatings C3 training is completed to provide workers with the background information on the hazards of lead and other toxic metals as well as the current legal and regulatory environment.
  • Quality Assurance Plans (QAPs) are prepared and staff members are trained by management in the quality expectations and procedures to ensure they are met.
  • Project Management Plans (PMPs) are prepared by project managers and the staff is trained in the completion of all projects according to the PMPs.
  • Process Improvement training is provided to our management and staff by our human resource consultant and includes topics such as recruitment, coaching, non-harassment and disciplining.

item.title: Asbestos
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
CORE Environmental provides consulting services relating to the identification, control and abatement of asbestos containing material for federal, state and private clients throughout the Eastern United States. Our project experience has included public buildings, industrial facilities, and commercial office buildings. Our highly qualified team includes hygienists, scientists, and technicians who are trained to provide a complete program of asbestos abatement services.

ASBESTOS SURVEYS AND INSPECTION

Asbestos surveys and inspections are provided by CORE to identify, locate, estimate quantities, and note the condition of asbestos containing materials (ACM). We also typically provide preliminary cost estimates for remediation. Our asbestos surveys are conducted in accordance with all applicable procedures in 40 CFR, Part 763 (Asbestos Hazard Emergency Response Act or AHERA), 40 CFR, Subpart M (National Emission Standard for Hazardous Air Pollutants or NESHAPS), and all applicable regulations.

ASBESTOS SAMPLING AND ANALYSIS

Our certified technicians are trained to perform bulk, wipe and air sampling for building surveys and asbestos abatement monitoring compliance. We work closely with several accredited asbestos laboratories to identify and quantify asbestos in bulk materials, wipe samples, and air samples. Our technicians can provide air monitoring during asbestos removal as well as clearance sampling for re-occupancy.

ASBESTOS REMEDIATION DESIGN AND SUPPORT

Following the completion of the asbestos survey, we can design a remediation plan for the subject property. The options available to address ACM include: removal, encapsulation, or operation and maintenance.

PROJECT MONITORING AND REPORTING

CORE Environmental can provide remediation project monitoring to ensure work is performed in compliance with federal, state, and local laws. We monitor projects for contractors' compliance with applicable laws as well as the project specifications. CORE Environmental typically prepares reports which document compliance through sampling, project submittals, inspection reports, and photographs. Final reports are prepared in detail and include all project related information such as notifications, sampling results, waste shipment records, and a complete summary of work.

item.title: Lead
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
CORE Environmental provides consulting services relating to the identification, control and abatement of lead based paint (LBP) for Federal, State and private clients throughout the Eastern United States. The projects our staff has completed have included: public buildings, bridges, municipal incinerator facilities, commercial office buildings and residential homes. Our highly qualified staff includes EPA certified lead inspectors and risk assessors; SSPC trained lead specialists, industrial hygienists, scientists and technicians who are trained to provide a complete program of lead abatement services.

LEAD BASED PAINT SURVEYS AND INSPECTIONS

Lead paint surveys and inspections are provided by CORE to locate, quantify and evaluate the condition of painted surfaces to support a wide variety of abatement, construction and demolition projects. We also typically provide preliminary or budgetary cost estimates for abatement/control during this survey phase. Our general approach for performing LBP surveys is summarized below. CORE initiates LBP projects by developing a plan for sampling painted surfaces which potentially contain lead. Based on the results of the LBP sampling CORE usually prepares a report summarizing the results of the survey/inspection. The project report provides an assessment of the impact/risk of the proposed site work activities with respect to LBP. The report will contain recommendations for LBP removal/control, specified challenges associated with containment, ingress and egress and any other critical issues. Reports contain an assessment of the associated risk.

LEAD BASED PAINT REMEDIATION DESIGN AND SUPPORT

Following the completion of the LBP survey, CORE can design a LBP control plan and LBP abatement plan as required. These plans include abatement and lead control measures to allow work to be performed in accordance with all regulations.

LEAD BASED PAINT REMEDIATION MONITORING

CORE can provide LBP remediation project monitoring to ensure work is performed in compliance with all client and regulatory requirements. We monitor projects for contractors' compliance with applicable laws and the project specifications.

item.title: Health & Safety
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
CORE believes that Safety and Quality are virtues that will continue to elevate us above others in the industry. Each and every project undertaken by CORE is conducted in strict compliance with all applicable federal, state, and local regulations. CORE has a corporate health and safety program and develops a site specific health and safety plan for each individual contract. CORE employees will utilize their extensive technical expertise of the appropriate environmental and occupational health and safety rules and regulations for all projects, contracts and undertakings. This is done to ensure that the safety programs developed are understood and enforced by all employees, and include:
  • Corporate health & safety program
  • Hazard determination, including exposure assessment
  • Track safety training
  • Respiratory protection program
  • Annual respirator fit tests
  • Hazardous communications program
  • Confined space entry program
  • MSDS manual and maintenance
  • Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs)
  • Protective clothing and equipment
  • Equipment preventative maintenance
  • Project inspections
  • Medical surveillance and provisions for medical removal
  • Job-specific compliance programs
  • Engineering and work practice controls
  • Good Housekeeping practice
  • Hygiene facilities
  • Posted Signs
  • Employee training and Recordkeeping

item.title: Audits
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
CORE Environmental has conducted numerous facility compliance audits and assessments for environmental permit compliance, property transfers and financing and site characterization of hazardous substances.

COMPLIANCE AUDITS

Our compliance audits are designed to review facility compliance with applicable Federal and state environmental laws and regulations including permit/consent decree conditions such as AAI, CAA, CWA, RCRA, TSCA, SARA, SDWA, N/SPDES, Petroleum and Chemical Bulk Storage etc., (see list of statutes). In addition to assessing facility compliance, we recommend cost-effective compliance maintenance options and remedial measures. We have developed computer programs designed to track compliance, notification and confirmation of corrective action and to generate exception reports on a regular basis.

PROPERTY TRANSFER ASSESSMENTS

Our property transfer assessments have included ISRA (formerly ECRA), or ISRA-type, SARA "Innocent Landowner" investigations, pre-financing audits required by banks, pre-lease environmental baseline conditions, as well as those required just prior to development of specific plans for site use. These audits may include record review and site reconnaissance, with site-specific circumstances and audit objectives dictating the extent and scope of the audit. The scope of some audits may also include preparation of site cleanup plans and monitoring of remedial actions, as well as preparation of numerical estimates of the potential environmental liabilities. Audits may include preparation of site cleanup and monitoring plans.

PETROLEUM BULK STORAGE

CORE routinely performs petroleum bulk storage compliance audits for our clients to ensure a facility is in full compliance with the New York State Petroleum Bulk Storage (PBS) Regulations, 6NYCRR 612- 614. CORE utilizes the NYSDEC audit checklist, documents the findings and makes recommendations in order to bring the facility into full compliance. Our audits normally include:
  • Accuracy of PBS facility registration
  • Accuracy of As-Built drawings
  • Check of PBS tank and system labeling
  • Maintenance of tank top sumps, gaskets, fitting, hoses, filters, fill ports, leak detection sensors, high level alarms and cathodic protection systems
  • Monitoring system records, LDS printouts and 10 day reconciliation
  • AST inspection reports and record keeping
  • Signs of and environmental spills
  • Overdue testing of equipment, LDS maintenance, tightness testing of tank and ancillary, piping and testing of cathodic protection systems
  • Environmental safety issues such as tripping hazards, metal fencing, electrical hazards and industrial hygiene issues
All Appropriate Inquiry (AAI),Clean Water Act (CWA), Clean Air Act (CAA), Resource Conservation & Recovery Act (RCRA), Toxic Substances Control Act (TSCA), Comprehensive Environmental Response, Compensation & Liability Act (CERCLA/Superfund), Superfund Amendments & Reauthorization Act (SARA), Safe Drinking Water Act (SDWA), Federal Insecticide, Fungicide & Rodenticide Act (FIFRA), State/local acts.

item.title: Environmental Compliance
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
SPILL PREVENTION, CONTROL AND COUNTERMEASURES

CORE has completed numerous Spill Prevention, Control and Countermeasures Plans (SPCC) for both construction projects and facilities that store more than 1,300 gallons of petroleum aboveground or 42,000 gallons of petroleum underground in accordance with Title 40, Federal Code of Regulations, Part 112. CORE has recently completed SPCC plans for the New York City Department of Environmental Protection, Bureau of Wastewater, at fifteen waste water pollution control plants and eight pumping stations. CORE has completed SPCC plans for facilities throughout the northeast United States. CORE has extensive experience in the preparation of SPCC plans for airport tenants, petroleum bulk storage and industrial facilities. CORE prepares these plans in full compliance with 40 CFR 112. Our plans typically include:
  • Written descriptions of any spills occurring within the past year, corrective actions taken, and plans for preventing their reoccurrence.
  • A prediction of the direction, rate of flow, and total quantity of oil that could be discharged where experience indicates a potential for equipment failure.
  • A description of secondary containment or diversionary structures or equipment to prevent discharged oil from reaching navigable waters, these must include dikes, berms, retaining walls, curbing, culverting, or other drainage systems.
  • Where appropriate, a demonstration that containment and/or diversionary structures or equipment are not practical and a strong oil spill contingency plan and a written commitment of manpower, equipment and materials to quickly control an remove spilled oil.
  • A complete discussion of the spill prevention and control measures applicable to the facility and/or its operations.

STORMWATER POLLUTION PREVENTION PLANS

CORE routinely prepares Stormwater Pollution Prevention Plans (SWPPP) to comply with the requirements of State Pollution Elimination Discharge Systems general permit for construction activities GP-02-01. CORE has completed SWPPPs for airport tenants, petroleum bulk storage and industrial facilities as well as solid waste facilities. This SWPPP is designed to show what personnel can do to eliminate or reduce pollutants that may enter the stormwater drainage system. Stormwater runoff is water from rain or melting snow that does not soak into the ground but runs off into waterways. As stormwater flows toward the nearest waterway, it collects and transports pollutants. Stormwater typically enters onsite catch basins, roof drains, and storm sewers which lead to the outfalls. The SWPPP focuses on two major objectives:
  • Identifying sources of pollution at the leasehold area that potentially affect the quality of the water discharged
  • Ensuring implementation of measures to minimize and control pollutants in stormwater.
The discharger is required to thoroughly evaluate all potential pollution sources at and select and implement appropriate measures designed to prevent or control the discharge of pollutants to waterways of the United States.

BEST MANAGEMENT PRACTICES

The main opportunity to control pollutants from reaching waterways is by Best Management Practices (BMPs), which are a schedule of activities, prohibition of practices, maintenance procedures, and other management practices to prevent or reduce pollution. Appropriate BMPs are selected for a facility based on an assessment of operations and potential stormwater impacts. Areas of actual or potential pollutant contact are identified and evaluated for applicable BMPs to eliminate or reduce the pollutants potential to impact stormwater. BMPs include treatment requirements, operating procedures, and practices to control site runoff, spills or leaks, sludge or waste disposal, or drainage from raw material. BMPs are often subdivided into source control and treatment control BMPs. Source control BMPs are operational practices intended to prevent pollutants from entering surface waters by altering activities to eliminate or minimize pollution produced as the result of the activity. Source control BMPs are categorized as general or activity based BMPs. Examples of general source control BMPs include: Moving an outdoor operation or activity indoors, Placing material storage containers in a shed or under cover and Covering waste containers Activity based source control BMPs focus on specific activities such as: Vehicle and equipment maintenance, Vehicle fueling and Building maintenance operations Treatment control BMPs are optional practices intended to remove pollutants in stormwater through treatment. Examples of treatment control BMPs include:
  • Detention/retention ponds
  • Oil water separators
  • Landscaped grass swales

item.title: Hello world!
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Welcome to WordPress. This is your first post. Edit or delete it, then start blogging!

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Hi, this is a comment. To delete a comment, just log in and view the post's comments. There you will have the option to edit or delete them.

item.title: Sample Page
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
This is an example page. It's different from a blog post because it will stay in one place and will show up in your site navigation (in most themes). Most people start with an About page that introduces them to potential site visitors. It might say something like this:
Hi there! I'm a bike messenger by day, aspiring actor by night, and this is my blog. I live in Los Angeles, have a great dog named Jack, and I like piña coladas. (And gettin' caught in the rain.)
...or something like this:
The XYZ Doohickey Company was founded in 1971, and has been providing quality doohickeys to the public ever since. Located in Gotham City, XYZ employs over 2,000 people and does all kinds of awesome things for the Gotham community.
As a new WordPress user, you should go to your dashboard to delete this page and create new pages for your content. Have fun!

item.title: Remediation
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
CORE Environmental is committed to provide its clients with the most cost-effective remediation services available. Planning and evaluating site specific conditions are a critical step in designing and implementing a cost effective remedial solution. Our petroleum remediation specialists have the experience and training required to plan, design and implement remedial programs which will provide for the ultimate goal of regulatory compliance.

DESIGN APPROACHES

Our remediation design specialists have experience in many remedial approaches in real world applications. Some of the types of systems CORE personnel have designed to address various types of contaminated sites include:
  • Pump & Treat
  • Dual Phase Extraction
  • Bioremediation ORC, Bio-Injecting
  • Natural Attenuation with Monitoring
  • Soil Vapor Extraction
  • Bio-Venting
  • Peroxide Injections
  • Chemical Oxidation

REMEDIAL METHODS

CORE Environmental personnel have utilized an innovative approach to evaluate remedial methods. A typical remedial design program may involve costly pump testing and pilot studies during the project pre-design phase to evaluate critical design parameters, such as soil permeability and areas of air flow influence for SVE and dual phase systems. During the investigation and pre-design phase our personnel developed wellhead assemblies to allow field crew members to perform SVE air flow tests and dual phase recovery tests utilizing a vac truck. This method was also utilized to perform short term pumping tests to obtain critical design information. These cost effective tests allow designers the ability to select and size systems to determine recovery well placement. Our personnel have extensive experience in operating and maintaining remedial systems for optimum performance. We also provide regulatory support services relating to the permitting and monitoring of remedial systems. CORE’s field support crews are experienced and trained to perform a variety of O&M Services.

item.title: Due Diligence
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
CORE's environmental professionals have performed numerous Phase I and II ESAs, Corridor Assessment Reports (CARs) and Limited Subsurface Corridor Investigations (LSCIs).

PHASE I ENVIRONMENTAL SITE ASSESSMENTS

Our scope was developed in accordance with all the latest standards and rulings on the completion of Phase I ESAs and environmental due diligence. Our Phase I ESAs meet the requirements of ASTM E 1527-05 Standard Practice for Environmental Site Assessments: Phase I ESA Process, as well as the EPA rule, "Standards for Conducting All Appropriate Inquiries” (AAI) (40 CFR Part 312).

PHASE II ENVIRONMENTAL SITE ASSESSMENTS

The CORE team has completed numerous Phase II investigations in cases where our own Phase I investigations indicated potential site contamination. The scopes of these Phase II investigations have been individually tailored by our environmental professionals to suit the specific characteristics of each site and the overall investigation objectives. Generally, a Phase II may involve subsurface investigations which could include geophysical explorations, soil gas surveys, soil sampling, and groundwater sampling.

CLOSURE/ REMEDIAL INVESTIGATIONS

CORE provides tank closure investigations typically involving soil and groundwater sampling to comply with all applicable regulations. All closure investigation data is summarized in a closure report consistent with regulatory requirements.

HAZARDOUS WASTE INVESTIGATIONS

Our environmental professionals have also completed RI\FS projects at sites where Phase II investigations indicated the presence of hazardous materials in soil or groundwater at levels which posed a potential threat to human health or the environment.

item.title: Tanks
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
CORE Environmental provides consulting services related to our clients Petroleum Bulk Storage (PBS) programs. Our experience includes significant testing, database preparation, permitting and design services relating to the upgrade, replacement and remediation of aboveground and underground storage tanks. CORE along with the right subcontractors, have progressed numerous tank projects from comprehensive compliance planning and database preparation to evaluation, testing, design and sometimes upgrading to meet the appropriate regulations.

PBS COMPLIANCE SERVICES

Core routinely performs petroleum bulk storage compliance audits for our clients to ensure a facility is in full compliance with the New York State Petroleum Bulk Storage (PBS) Regulations, 6NYCRR 612-614. Core utilizes the NYSDEC audit checklist, documents the findings, and makes recommendations in order to bring the facility into full compliance.

TANK TESTING SERVICES

CORE has extensive experience in testing AST and UST systems. Our testing has identified numerous faulty tank and tank systems and prevented further leakage. All our test results are reviewed to recognize test failures or inconclusive test results by our senior staff. Our tightness testing is performed by educated, trained and certified technicians. The test methodologies we use are EPA, NFPA, NYSDEC and NJDEP approved.

TANK REMOVAL/CLOSURE SERVICES

CORE’s team has extensive experience in preparing timely and cost effective plans and specifications for replacement and/or closure of UST and AST systems. We have a proven approach that has removed or closed in place 100’s of tanks and apparatus. Our approach has often included pre-removal sampling and analysis in an effort to remediate stained soils, if any, during closure activities. This approach has allowed us to close many state spill reports after sampling and analysis have been submitted for review avoiding further investigations and remedial efforts.

TANK DESIGN SERVICES

CORE’s tank system design personnel have extensive experience in preparing timely and cost effective plans and specifications for the upgrade, replacement and/or closure of UST and AST systems. Our approach has been successfully utilized for numerous clients. It typically includes a regulatory review, tank tightness testing, site survey and records review and a throughput analysis. Other design activities may include, but not be limited to, field inspection, constructability analysis of design, and informational meetings.

item.title: Environmental Review
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
The work experience of our staff encompasses the full range of environmental review services ranging from preliminary classification of an action, environmental permitting, resource evaluation, Federal National Environmental Policy Act (NEPA) and State Environmental Quality Review Act (SEQRA) review services, Environmental Impact Statements (EIS) and Municipal Services.

ENVIRONMENTAL PERMITTING

CORE has experience in the planning, scheduling, application preparation, and client support for federal, state and local environmental permits, licenses, certificates and other approvals including Army Corps of Engineers (ACOE) Section 10/404 Permits, Clean Water Act WQC Approvals, NYSDEC State Pollution Discharge Elimination System (SPDES) permit applications, U.S. Coast Guard navigational permits as well as Storm Water Pollution Prevention Plans (SWPPP).

RESOURCE EVALUATION

CORE has experience in the evaluation of resources for environmental review including; Coordinating Phase IA and IB cultural resource investigations, wetland delineations and mitigation plans, air quality and noise studies, land use/zoning studies, traffic impact studies, visual impact studies, cultural resources surveys, threatened/endangered species research, impacts to farmland and prime agricultural soils and Water Resources Studies including Coastal Zone Assessments.

NEPA AND SEQR REVIEW

CORE understands NEPA and SEQRA and can select the proper environmental classification, and conduct the appropriate level of environmental review. We have performed NEPA and SEQRA classifications and resolved environmental issues on many locally administered projects.

ENVIRONMENTAL IMPACT STATEMENTS (EIS)

CORE has experience in the preparation of Environmental Impact Statements (EIS) including: preparation of Environmental Assessment Forms (EAFs), coordination of lead agency status & scoping, determination of significance and positive/negative declarations, public outreach/ participation programs, EIS review and preparation, notice and findings statements.

MUNICIPAL HIGHWAY AND BRIDGE ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES

Our staff is experienced in municipal highway, bridge and related contract’s environmental components including air, noise and water studies, wetland delineation, cultural resource studies, hazardous materials studies, asbestos and lead screening and surveys, abatement project and air monitoring, environmental permitting, storm water mitigation and SWPPPs.

item.title: Careers
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
CORE employs numerous persons with various educational backgrounds, knowledge and experience. Some of our people include:
  • Certified Asbestos Investigators, Designers and Monitors
  • CADD Engineers/Designers
  • Certified Lead Inspectors and Risk Assessors
  • Hygienists
  • Certified Hazardous Materials Managers
  • Environmental Engineers
  • Environmental Scientists
  • Technicians
  • Geologists
  • Hydrogeologists
  • Certified Environmental Professionals
  • Civil Engineers
  • Report Specialists
  • Administrative
CORE is always looking for qualified, highly motivated employees to fill a variety of positions. Candidates should have demonstrated experience or success along with motivation in the classroom. Experience on projects for state agencies and local municipalities are also recommended. CORE Environmental employs individuals with considerable experience or right out of college. At CORE, professionals work together using new, innovative ideas as well as application of best practices. CORE’s performance appraisal program provides frequent follow up, feedback and ideas for career development planning. Environmental services are highly regulated with multiple certifications necessary for our employees to be current with the requirements. We encourage all employees to seek out learning opportunities that will assist their performance and enhance revenues of the company. Training and licensing programs are available with reimbursements for fees for required initial and refresher courses needed to complete the job.

BENEFITS

We are committed to providing our competitive salaries while providing our clients with quality, value and leadership in our services. Your wage is only one part of the total benefits equation. At CORE, our payroll and benefits company assists us in providing a complete employment package. We offer eight (8) annual paid holidays for our full time staff in addition to paid time off for vacations, sick time as well as personal time.

WORK AND LIFE BALANCE

We understand the challenge in effectively meeting personal and work commitments. We have adopted paid time off and when possible within our office environment, flexible work schedules that enable you to enjoy your well-deserved time away from your career.

PROMOTING YOUR WELL BEING

CORE ensures that our full time employees and their families have access to high quality, comprehensive and affordable health care. Several options for medical, dental, and vision plans allow employees to choose the type of coverage they need. Flexible spending accounts help pay for medical expenses and dependent care with pre-tax dollars. Part-time employees are eligible for many of our benefits on a pro-rated basis.

PLANNING FOR YOUR FUTURE

Our payroll/benefits provider offers additional options for employees to enroll in such as basic life insurance and/or short- and long-term disability in order to maintain a portion of income if you are unable to work as well as retirement savings accounts through their financial programs.

DIVERSITY

It is the policy of CORE Environmental, Inc. (CORE) to provide equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, status as a disabled veteran, recently separated or other covered veteran, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law. In addition, CORE will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities. CORE’s goal is to achieve at least proportional representation of women and people of color across the company. Our programs are designed to comply with all applicable federal, state, and local laws, directives and regulations and cover all human resource actions including employment, compensation, benefits, training, education, tuition aid, transfers, promotions and social/recreational programs.

item.title: Apply Today
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
CORE welcomes all applicants in response to a specific positions published on this website and through other media sources. Send your cover letter and resume via any of these methods: USMail, Fax or email: HR@coreenv.com In addition, CORE can provide Internships to students. CORE is committed to supporting the education and innovation of new ideas and learning through on the job facilitation and experience. CORE can provide training and valuable experience to students within the industry with the potential for possible employment after graduation.

To view the current job openenings please go to: JOB OPENING'S

US Mail Addressed To:

CORE Environmental 1416 Main St Buffalo, NY 14209 ATTN: Careers FAX: 716-885-0543 ATTN: Careers

item.title: Job Openings
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
1. PROFESSIONAL ENGINEER:

This position will provide senior level technical and project management oversight on client projects. The candidate will develop strong client relationships based on client needs and expectations. This position will monitor work progress on projects, evaluate technical capabilities, review quality, review plans, prepare reports, review schedules and estimates and prepare proposals. Work encompasses project management & engineering of transportation projects, including roadway and pedestrian facilities design, route analyses and traffic studies. Drainage experience, roadway or otherwise, is a plus. Familiarity with NYSDOT standard practices and procedures is important. Environmental engineering experience is a plus. Minimum ten years experience (five years after registration as a Professional Engineer) with transportation project management experience. Bachelor of Science degree in Civil Engineering required. Strong written and verbal communication skills and the ability to manage subordinate staff within the parameters of company policies is necessary. Competitive salary and excellent benefits including health insurance, company-paid life and LTD, paid time off and leave of absence (sick) time.

2. ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENTIST/GEOLOGIST/ENGINEER:

Candidates must be an environmental engineer, scientist or geologist with 2 to 5 years experience with a consulting firm performing site assessments, remediation, permitting and lead/asbestos surveys. This position will provide Project Management and technical oversight on client projects. The candidate will develop strong client relationships based on client needs and expectations. Candidate should have strong writing, communication, and computer skills. This position will monitor work progress on projects, evaluate technical capabilities, review quality, review plans, prepare reports and plan schedules.
  • BS or MS degree is preferred.
  • Work is within the 5 boroughs of NYC. Vehicle required.
  • NYSDOL asbestos project monitor, inspector, and designers certifications desirable.
  • U.S. EPA Lead Investigator or Risk Assessor, OSHA HazWoper 40-hour training or 10-hour Construction Safety training also desirable.
  • Reduced cost health insurance coverage, including dental and vision offered as well as numerous paid holidays.

3. DOL/NYCDEP ASBESTOS INSPECTORS, MONITORS OR DESIGNERS:

Asbestos Project Monitors and SSPC certified lead inspectors responsible for performing surveys, project monitoring, and construction monitoring of environmental and building system abatement projects relating to asbestos, lead paint and other hazardous materials. Salary is based on experience. Ideal Candidate should possess:
  • BS in Environmental Degree or Industrial Hygiene
  • NYSDOL Project Monitor
  • Asbestos/ Lead Inspector Certification
  • NYC investigators licenses
  • SPCC certification
  • Need At least 2 years industrial hygiene experience in the consulting or direct client sector
  • Experience with building systems and/or construction is preferred
  • Vehicle Required

4. EPA LEAD RISK ASSESSORS AND INSPECTORS:

Lead Risk Assessors and Inspectors are certified lead inspectors responsible for performing surveys, project monitoring, and construction monitoring of environmental and building system abatement projects relating to asbestos, lead paint and other hazardous materials. Salary is based on experience. The qualified candidate must have a vehicle and be willing to travel extensively throughout the city. The applicant must work well in a fast paced environment and be able to work independently; must be able to multi-task; must have good communication skills (both verbal and written). The candidate should have a thorough knowledge of both New York State and NYC Asbestos Regulations. Required certifications:
  • NYSDOL Asbestos Inspector
  • Project Monitor
  • Air Sampling Technician
  • EPA Lead Inspector
  • EPA Risk Assessor
  • A NYCDEP Asbestos Investigator license as well as additional industrial hygiene experience a plus.

5. CADD DESIGN DRAFTERS

Required Skills: Requirements include a high school diploma, and 2 year technical degree or equivalent and 1-5 years of experience in AUTOCAD drafting of documents for environmental projects. Work well in team setting. Formal supervision and leadership skills are a plus. Keen written and oral communication abilities desired. The ideal candidate will have experience drafting plans for NYC/NYS- DEP/DOT/DDC projects. Key Responsibilities:
  • Proficiency in design using AutoCAD
  • Maintains logistical information in the CADD system
  • Manage the document storage layouts and prints on CADD system
  • Assist in administrative responsibilities within the office
  • Assist in preparation of reports for clients. Other duties as assigned.
